tool.name: iterative-signature-algorithm

param.name: data
param.label: Data Matrix
param.help: Data matrix in which to seek modules.

param.name: nt
param.label: Non-threshold output
param.help: By default, rows and columns that are not included in a given module have scores 0. Setting this option to true runs an additional iteration without thresholding, so that scores are also attributed to excluded rows and columns

param.name: inputhaslabels
param.label: First column of data matrix contains labels
param.help: If the data matrix has labels, the output files will use them where applicable

param.name: inputhasheaders
param.label: First row of data matrix contains headers
param.help: If the data matrix has headers, the output files will use them where applicable

param.name: row
param.label: Row thresholds
param.help: Pass thresholds as a list [for example: 1,2,3] or as a range [for example: 1:1:3]

param.name: delta
param.label: Delta Same
param.help: If the correlation between the scores of two module is greater than Delta Same, the modules are considered equal. The module with the lower robustness of the two is dropped.

param.name: number
param.label: Number of seeds
param.help: Number of seeds used by ISA.

param.name: sparsity
param.label: Seed sparsity
param.help: If set to 0, a random matrix will be used as seed matrix. If set to i greater than 0, each seed column will have i randomly selected element(s) set to 1, all others being 0.

param.name: delta
param.label: Delta Convergence
param.help: A given module is considered converged when two successive iterations of the algorithm produce scores of correlation greater than Delta Convergence.

param.name: max
param.label: Maximum number of iterations
param.help: Any module that has not converged after this maximum number of iterations is dropped.

tool.help:
----------- Description -----------
A basic python3 implementation of the Iterative Signature Algorithm [ISA].
A more fully fledged R version is available here : https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/eisa.html
----------- Input Files -----------
**Data Matrix** | The data matrix in which the iterative signature algorithm will seek modules. The first row and first column are expected to contain labels, and are therefore not passed to the algorithm |
**Test Files** | A sample data matrix is available here : https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rrueedi/isa-py/init/ts/ts.csv | It has headers and labels
------------ Output Files ------------
**module.rowscore.tsv** | A tab-separated values file containing the row scores for each module. | If the input file has labeled rows, the output file has labeled rows, with the same labels
**module.colscore.tsv** | A tab-separated values file containing the column scores for each module. | If the input file has headers, the output file uses the headers as row labels
**module.info.tsv** | A tab-separated values file containg information about the modules found. Specifically: | * row 1 : module name | * row 2 : module robustness | * row 3 : row threshold at which module was found | * row 4 : column threshold at which module was found
